item.title: [PI] Thieving [SOLVED] (Solution is now in thread) Thanks everyone
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:524194”][quote author=Angel Carlos link=topic=642735.msg4328369#msg4328369 date=1373322694]
if c.thieving = false
return true
}

something like that.
[/quote]
close.
in walking.java
add:

[code=java]
if(c.thieving == true){
return;
}

in Player.java add:

public boolean thieving = false;

then your stealfromstall method (you could add this into your thieve npc too…

public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) { thieving = true; if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2250){ thieving = false; return; }if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0){ thieving = false; c.sendMessage("<col=278488>Your inventory is full.</col>"); return; } if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) { if(Misc.random(12) == 1) { c.sendMessage("<col=278488>You get caught trying to thieve from the stall.</col>"); c.startAnimation(3679); if(c.playerLevel[3] <= 30) { appendHit(Misc.random(4), c); } else { appendHit(Misc.random(10), c); return; } thieving = false; } c.sendMessage("You attempt to thieve from the stall."); c.getItems().addItem(id, 1); c.startAnimation(832); c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950); c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving); c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.sendMessage("You steal a <col=278488>" + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + ".</col>"); thieving = false; } else if(c.playerLevel[17] < level) { c.sendMessage("You need a Thieving level of <col=278488>"+level+"</col> to thieve from this stall."); thieving = false; } } [/quote]

Ahh. It still will not work, is there any way you could teamviewer me? This is a huge thing for me and I just can’t find a way to fix it. It’s the last thing on my list before I release my server.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Thieving [SOLVED] (Solution is now in thread) Thanks everyone
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Angel Carlos, post:16, topic:524194”]if c.thieving = false
return true
}

something like that.[/quote]
close.
in walking.java
add:

[code=java]
if(c.thieving == true){
return;
}

in Player.java add:

public boolean thieving = false;

then your stealfromstall method (you could add this into your thieve npc too…

        public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) {
				thieving = true;
                if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2250){
						thieving = false;
                        return;
                }if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0){
					thieving = false;
					c.sendMessage("<col=278488>Your inventory is full.</col>");
					return;
                }
                if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) {
                        if(Misc.random(12) == 1) {
                                c.sendMessage("<col=278488>You get caught trying to thieve from the stall.</col>");
                                c.startAnimation(3679);
                                if(c.playerLevel[3] <= 30) {
                                        appendHit(Misc.random(4), c);
                                } else {
                                        appendHit(Misc.random(10), c);
                                        return;
                                }
								thieving = false;
                        }
                        c.sendMessage("You attempt to thieve from the stall.");
                        c.getItems().addItem(id, 1);
                        c.startAnimation(832);
                        c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950);
                        c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving);
                        c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis();
                        c.sendMessage("You steal a <col=278488>" + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + ".</col>");
						thieving = false;
                        }                
                else if(c.playerLevel[17] < level) {
                        c.sendMessage("You need a Thieving level of <col=278488>"+level+"</col> to thieve from this stall.");
						thieving = false;
                }
        }

item.title: [PI] Thieving [SOLVED] (Solution is now in thread) Thanks everyone
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Check your walking.java to see if it us checking the thieve boolean

This is my walking.java [code]package server.model.players.packets;

import server.Server;
import server.model.players.Client;
import server.model.players.PacketType;

/**

  • Walking packet
    **/
    public class Walking implements PacketType {

    @Override
    public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
    if (packetType == 248 || packetType == 164) {
    c.faceUpdate(0);
    c.npcIndex = 0;
    c.playerIndex = 0;
    if (c.followId > 0 || c.followId2 > 0 || c.follow2 > 0)
    c.getPA().resetFollow();
    }
    c.fishing = false;
    if(!c.isBanking && !c.inTrade) {
    c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
    c.startAnimation(65535);
    }
    if (c.isBanking)
    c.isBanking = false;
    if (c.storing)
    c.storing = false;
    if (c.isShopping)
    c.isShopping = false;
    if(c.duelRule[1] && c.duelStatus == 5) {
    if(Server.playerHandler.players[c.duelingWith] != null) {
    if(!c.goodDistance(c.getX(), c.getY(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.duelingWith].getX(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.duelingWith].getY(), 1) || c.attackTimer == 0) {
    c.sendMessage(“Walking has been disabled in this duel!”);
    }
    }
    c.playerIndex = 0;
    return;
    }
    if(c.inTrade) {
    return;
    }

     if(c.freezeTimer > 0) {
 	if(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex] != null) {
 		if(c.goodDistance(c.getX(), c.getY(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].getX(), Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].getY(), 1) && packetType != 98) {
 			c.playerIndex = 0;	
 			return;
 		}
 	}
 	if (packetType != 98) {
 		c.sendMessage("A magical force stops you from moving.");
 		c.playerIndex = 0;
 	}	
 	return;
 }
 
 if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastSpear < 4000) {
 	c.sendMessage("You have been stunned.");
 	c.playerIndex = 0;
 	return;
 }
 
 if (packetType == 98) {
 	c.mageAllowed = true;
 	c.fishing = false;
 }
 		if (c.sit == true) {
 	c.sendMessage("::unsit before you can start walking again!");
 	return;
 }
 
 if((c.duelStatus >= 1 && c.duelStatus <= 4) || c.duelStatus == 6) {
 	if(c.duelStatus == 6) {
 		c.getTradeAndDuel().claimStakedItems();		
 	}
 	return;
 }
 
 
 if(c.respawnTimer > 3) {
 	return;
 }
 if(c.inTrade) {
 	return;
 }
 if(packetType == 248) {
 	packetSize -= 14;
 }
 c.newWalkCmdSteps = (packetSize - 5)/2;
 if(++c.newWalkCmdSteps > c.walkingQueueSize) {
 	c.newWalkCmdSteps = 0;
 	return;
 }
 
 c.getNewWalkCmdX()[0] = c.getNewWalkCmdY()[0] = 0;
 
 int firstStepX = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndianA()-c.getMapRegionX()*8;
 for(int i = 1; i < c.newWalkCmdSteps; i++) {
 	c.getNewWalkCmdX()[i] = c.getInStream().readSignedByte();
 	c.getNewWalkCmdY()[i] = c.getInStream().readSignedByte();
 }
 
 int firstStepY = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian()-c.getMapRegionY()*8;
 c.setNewWalkCmdIsRunning(c.getInStream().readSignedByteC() == 1);
 for(int i1 = 0; i1 < c.newWalkCmdSteps; i1++) {
 	c.getNewWalkCmdX()[i1] += firstStepX;
 	c.getNewWalkCmdY()[i1] += firstStepY;
 }

    }

}[/code]

How exactly would I make it check that boolean?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

I already have that timer set up and the variable declared in player.java it’s still letting me mass click and not move until it processes them all. Here’s my stealfromstall method now, fully working except the mass click thing.

public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2250) return; if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0){ c.sendMessage("<col=278488>Your inventory is full.</col>"); return; } if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) { if(Misc.random(12) == 1) { c.sendMessage("<col=278488>You get caught trying to thieve from the stall.</col>"); c.startAnimation(3679); if(c.playerLevel[3] <= 30) { appendHit(Misc.random(4), c); } else { appendHit(Misc.random(10), c); return; } } c.sendMessage("You attempt to thieve from the stall."); c.getItems().addItem(id, 1); c.startAnimation(832); c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950); c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving); c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.sendMessage("You steal a <col=278488>" + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + ".</col>"); } else if(c.playerLevel[17] < level) { c.sendMessage("You need a Thieving level of <col=278488>"+level+"</col> to thieve from this stall."); } }

item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

[quote=“Angel Carlos, post:7, topic:524194”]Maybe change this to:

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve > 2000000000000000000000000000000000000000) {

and also, check if the lasthieve is in player.java or something.[/quote]

It’s not that, it has to do with something else. Last thieve is for when you can thieve again from the stall. Making it that number would take way to long to be able to thieve once again from it and wouldn’t fix my problem. And lastthieve in player.java doesn’t do anything. It’s not my thieving class I’m thinking because I have the same class on an old source I used to have and you can move even if you mass click it right after. So I’m guessing it’s something with walking or how stuff is processed.

item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:524194”] public void stealFromStall(int stall) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() != 0) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve > 2000) { StallData sd = forStall(stall); if (sd != null) { if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= sd.getLevel()) { c.getItems().addItem(getRandom(stall), 1); c.startAnimation(832); c.getPA().addSkillXP(sd.getXP(), c.playerThieving); c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.sendMessage("You steal from the stall."); } else { c.sendMessage("You need a thieving level of at least "+sd.getLevel()+" to steal from this stall."); } } } } else { c.sendMessage("Not enough space in your inventory."); return; } }
This is identical to what is in my flax picking class, but instead of my method it’s yours.[/quote]

Okay! The inventory is full thing is now fixed, also had to do some stuff in actionhandler.java but know do you know how to fix my second problem? It doesn’t let you move until it’s done thieving, this is horrible if you mass click it because it has to wait till it gets all those clicks that you did before you can move. I’m totally lost on this one.

item.title: [PI] Thieving [SOLVED] (Solution is now in thread) Thanks everyone
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

	public void stealFromStall(int stall) {
		if (c.getItems().freeSlots() != 0) {
			if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve > 2000) {
				StallData sd = forStall(stall);
				if (sd != null) {
					if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= sd.getLevel()) {
						c.getItems().addItem(getRandom(stall), 1);
						c.startAnimation(832);
						c.getPA().addSkillXP(sd.getXP(), c.playerThieving);
						c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis();
						c.sendMessage("You steal from the stall.");
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("You need a thieving level of at least "+sd.getLevel()+" to steal from this stall.");
					}
				}
			}
		} else {
			c.sendMessage("Not enough space in your inventory.");
			return;
		}
	}

This is identical to what is in my flax picking class, but instead of my method it’s yours.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Thieving [SOLVED] (Solution is now in thread) Thanks everyone
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

[quote=“Angel Carlos, post:2, topic:524194”]1) Add a timer.
2) Do you even player.java full inv???
3) Thieving class looks small to be even non bugged.[/quote]

How would I go about adding a timer? And what do you mean by that? I have my freeslots in itemassitant.java

public int freeSlots(){ int freeS = 0; for (int i=0; i < c.playerItems.length; i++){ if (c.playerItems[i] <= 0){ freeS++; } } return freeS; }
And it works for everything else except thieving I just don’t get it.

sk8rdude461:

In: public void stealFromStall(int stall) { add: if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0){ return; } it goes under: if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve > 2000) {

See, I’ve done this close to a million times, it just doesn’t stop thieving. I even added a boolean once to player.java saying thieving = false and adding the method in here but it didn’t work either. When I thieve and my inventory is full it will still give me exp. Here’s how you told me to do it, public void stealFromStall(int stall) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve > 2000) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0){ return; } StallData sd = forStall(stall); if (sd != null) { if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= sd.getLevel()) { c.getItems().addItem(getRandom(stall), 1); c.startAnimation(832); c.getPA().addSkillXP(sd.getXP(), c.playerThieving); c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.sendMessage("You steal from the stall."); } else { c.sendMessage("You need a thieving level of at least "+sd.getLevel()+" to steal from this stall."); } } } } }

item.title: [PI] Thieving [SOLVED] (Solution is now in thread) Thanks everyone
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

EDIT: I fixed the first problem; now I just need the second one, the most important one.

How I fixed it: Well everyone that tried to help me had me on the right path but it just didn’t seem to work. So I finally just went into config.java and changed the “max_process_packets” to 10 from 4. That solved my problem! Thanks everyone!

When a player mass clicks the stall and tries to move they can’t move until the stall finishes receiving all the clicks the player produced on it. It’s driving me insane. If you could help it would just be amazing. Thank you so much.
I’m 100% sure this isn’t related to my thieving class anymore because I have the same Thieving class on another source and when the player mass clicks and tries to move, it actually works. So if you could help me with this it would me amazing.
But here’s my stealfromstall method just in case.

public void stealFromStall(int id, int xp, int level) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastThieve < 2250) return; if (c.getItems().freeSlots() == 0){ c.sendMessage("<col=278488>Your inventory is full.</col>"); return; } if (c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] >= level) { if(Misc.random(12) == 1) { c.sendMessage("<col=278488>You get caught trying to thieve from the stall.</col>"); c.startAnimation(3679); if(c.playerLevel[3] <= 30) { appendHit(Misc.random(4), c); } else { appendHit(Misc.random(10), c); return; } } c.sendMessage("You attempt to thieve from the stall."); c.getItems().addItem(id, 1); c.startAnimation(832); c.getItems().addItem(995, c.playerLevel[c.playerThieving] * 950); c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp * Config.THIEVING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerThieving); c.lastThieve = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.sendMessage("You steal a <col=278488>" + server.model.items.Item.getItemName(id) + ".</col>"); } else if(c.playerLevel[17] < level) { c.sendMessage("You need a Thieving level of <col=278488>"+level+"</col> to thieve from this stall."); } }

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Thieving [SOLVED] (Solution is now in thread) Thanks everyone
